intro: Aganisia alba, commonly known as the white aganisia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its white, woolly leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in dense forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
